name: Computer Science
details: Computer Science is a four-year program that covers a wide range of topics in computer science, including programming, algorithms, and software development.

name: Business Administration
details: The Business Administration program offers a comprehensive curriculum in business management, economics, and entrepreneurship.

name: Engineering
details: Engineering is a rigorous program where students can specialize in electrical, mechanical, civil, or other engineering disciplines.

name: Psychology
details: Psychology explores the human mind and behavior. The program includes courses in clinical psychology, counseling, and research methods.

name: Biology
details: Biology students study the natural world and can participate in research projects and labs to gain hands-on experience.

name: Economics
details: Economics focuses on the study of markets, finance, and economic policy. Students can participate in study abroad programs.

name: Environmental Science
details: Environmental Science involves fieldwork and research on environmental issues, including collaboration with local organizations.

name: Art History
details: Art History explores the history and cultural significance of art and visual culture. Graduates can work in museums and galleries.

name: Political Science
details: Political Science research areas include international relations, comparative politics, and political theory.
